quote: A fun night for families of our community. Games, stories, contests, photo booth and snacks.
We have invited our clients, consultants, brokers who have worked with us, and friends we have met these last two years.
We celebrated Kitchener's German heritage by celebrating Oktoberfest as a group. Before the festivities, one of the neighbourhood families welcomed anyone and everyone into their home for dinner.

Weather wasn't cooperating much, so when we saw a sunny break, we reached out to as many park families as we could to invite them for cookies, hot chocolate, candy canes, and festive tree decorating fun!

activity: Colin's 3rd Annual Toy Drive for Anselma House
quote: Colin has been doing this for years now, and we often hear from others that he has inspired them to help the Anselma House specifically, or another charity of their choice. At the Toy Drive we always have a chance to meet new faces, and visit with familiar ones.

activity: Holiday Potluck and Annual General Meeting
quote: Neighbours are starting to see this as an annual event to get together and connect with other residents. It also informs residents of some of the great work the VPNA has been up to and provides an opportunity for residents to provide feedback on suggested improvements, ideas, etc.
Encourages neighbours to gather and learn about the history of the area/neighbourhood.

activity: Community Movie Night - Mr. Peabody and Sherman
quote: Had new faces attend the event, as well as many people who have made these movie evenings a regular part of their attendance at the centre.
Kids brought glowsticks, flashlights and hot chocolate as we walked through the neighbourhood admiring the Christmas Lights.

activity: Family Day Activities, inside and outside
quote: Welcoming first time skaters and having freshly sharpened skates for them to borrow! Family Fun Photo studio, crafts, hot chocolate are the perfect invitations for neighbours.
It was a fall celebration where everyone was invited to the Brubacher Green Park and to bring along with them their favourite soup and then we had a neighbourhood potluck sharing everyone's soups.
Free event that would bring our community together in the winter! We approached different organizations to ask them to host the activities.
We had a skating party with tobogganing, snowshoeing, hockey shootout challenges, curling, hot chocolate, and hot dogs.

activity: Family Day Weekend Sledding and Skating Party
quote: Helped connect neighbours with neighbours who might not otherwise have reason to do so.

Provided community members with a place to enjoy Halloween safely as well as to introduce neighbours to each other.  By using the community centre helped create awareness of the building and all the services it can offer to the community.
Provided a free space that was accessible to all children in the community regardless of ability.  The event was free making it accessible to people of all socio-economic statuses.

This gathering produced a large number of new faces to the community centre that we had not previously seen.  It provided opportunities to seek out information and suggestions from community members and for community members to see what their community centre as to offer.
Provided an event for families to come together to engage in crafts and swimming with their children or for individuals to come out and meet other people in their community.
The night out includes the whole street.  After dinner we were back to one of the houses on the street for dessert and coffee! We know we have a very unique street.
It brings our community together "belonging" and allows people and families to meet each other. Many of our children go to different schools and it is great to bring people together in our community.
It is such a great dance for families and the children have so much fun. We have hula hoop competitions and children all get to take home something.
This is a monthly movie series that invites the community to come and share time together.

This was an amazing event that brings our community together. We decorate a Christmas tree, we provide snacks. Children get to make crafts, decorate a gingerbread and have fun. Santa visited this year. Attendees also trace their hand, and all the hands is made into a Christmas tree that we put up the following year.
It allows people to meet from different areas in our neighbourhood and sometimes families and children meet who attend different schools.
Some families make this a monthly outing to enjoy as a family.
The monthly movie is an event that community members enjoy each month and families are able to bring everyone.
The association decorates the community centre in the theme of the event, and families love to attend. Children participate in dances and everyone goes home with  something.
We have made the KW Tenant Group to help bring the families together and to help bring our buildings up to code.
Our community is still new so we are making memories and building history.

Each time we gather together for an event, we begin to brainstorm another.  The momentum began a couple of years ago - and shows no signs of slowing.  Many traditions have formed.  New families are easily welcomed at each event, and connections are constantly being made.
Just one more way for neighbours to feel comfortable with each other and reconnect after a long, cold winter.

Accessibility for those who were mobility challenged: We ensure that bathrooms are wheelchair accessible... a single level for everything... provide special up-close parking for mobility challenged and seniors.
Providing people with a sense of connection as well as a way for their voices to be heard about the new playground.
We enjoy bringing people together, encouraging people to just have fun together.
Seeing families and friends come  together and having fun!
Seeing children outdoor, active, having fun.
Every year we have new people attend, and we always receive positive comments about the accomplishment.

People could choose how and where to participate (families with young children often chose flat, easy to reach places, while others went to harder to reach areas). Some poles/pickers were provided for those who had trouble picking up from the ground.

activity: Birdwatching at Victoria Park Jane's Walk
quote: It helped people see their environment/community in a new way. Downtown is often considered a busy, commercial area with its share of problems. However, we showed a different side of the neighbourhood by spending a couple of hours in nature right in the downtown area.

These are a direct result of either n'hood bbqs or weekly potlucks - neighbours finding work, furnishing their home or having repairs done.

We worked together to clean up the neighbourhood and remove any unsightly or dangerous items.

Those of us participating spent an entire morning out front. Often, families in our neighbourhood play together in back yards, or at the park. This was a nice way to meet people as they walked by our homes, and allowed us a chance to visit while we were working our garage sales.
Our purpose was to have individuals of all ages and abilities working side-by-side, helping our neighbours.
Every year we grow and try to have many activities for everyone!

activity: SPA Day at Forest Heights Long Term Care Centre
quote: One exciting result that came out of this specific event was that one of our volunteers, in discussion with a male resident, discovered he had no family or visitors so she has decided to occasionally visit with him and play ping pong.

It provided a safe and fun activity to bring the neighbourhood together
Open to anyone and asked a group of parents to spread the word to Fridays and neighbors. It was the first year we did this and we could do better at this for next year.
I think the parents of the kids feel that there are lots of friendly families on the street now so their kids are being looked out for.
Connecting neighbours to each other as well as to our community centre. Using a map to allow neighbours to focus on and share of the positive parts of the neighbourhood.
That neighbours came out to meet each other and that now they look forward to this annual event.
That families came out and were new to the area.
A large majority of students are bussed. Getting families together that aren't often given a chance to mingle at the school helps to build relationships.

activity: Annual Tremaine Park BBQ and Fundraiser
quote: We're building traditions.  Kids and families look forward to these opportunities to get together with neighbours. YES - we don't just run the event to mingle with neighbours.  We intentionally set out to raise money for a local cause.  Each time we choose a charity that provides assistance to all neighbourhoods - including ours.  This year the recipient was the Food Bank.
People have come to expect exciting things happening in the Park!  We love our neighbours and the support shown by each family whenever we aim to put an activity together.

As we continue these events, we see that people are developing in our community. Neighbours are getting to know each other, it is really exciting to see the neighbourhood coming together at these hosted events.
The Fairy Walk was a pretty magical day. It helped us bring people together and give people a sense of pride in our quirkiness. sometimes that's all you need.

activity: March Movie Madness: March 01: Book of Life
quote: This is a  great event that allows family to get together and watch a movie together. Some families come over and over again to our movies and several friendships have developed between neighbours. You also get to watch a good movie! It is really informal and a good way for people to START coming to our programs in  a very non intimidating way.

I love these dances, and they are amazing place to meet friends in the neighbourhood. I personally have gotten to know other parents at the dance; and it great to see the children dancing together. Once of the things I really like about the dances is that the children in our neighbourhood can go to 5 different schools, and this is a great way to get them to know each other.

I can't speak high enough about our dances as they are an amazing way to bring community together. They are inclusive, involve youth in several different ways. Children have fun and get to know each other from different schools. This is an inclusive, fun, safe event for everyone.

Family friendly way to watch a movie. Our snack bar is open for people to buy snacks. It is a great way for an entire family to watch a movie on a Sunday afternoon; a great way for families to see a newer release. It is inclusive, friendly and safe and FUN

quote: Our movie madness is inclusive of everyone in the community, friendly and safe!

activity: June Movie Madness - Sponge Out of Water
quote: A great way for families to get together and watch a family friendly movie together. Several families come out regularly and it is a great way for them to be together and meet other people and families. They also get to watch a great, recent film.

Our neighbourhood is much more connected as a result of our party. I love living on this street - it is a GREAT group of people. We created our own Facebook page that people have been able to go and see all our pictures from the event and remember the great time we had that day. https://www.facebook.com/groups/139101313088025/ People have been connecting on FB as well as on linked-In. Our neighbours are constantly waving and saying hello - more so than before. I find that both ends of the street now know each other whereas before they just recognized each other. People definitely loved the party and can't wait until we organize another!

Reasons for the BBQ include providing an opportunity for people to get to know each other, to find out what they do and don't like about where they live and to get ideas about what they think would make this a better area to live. It accomplished all of these goals.

Yes. Neighbours met each other face to face, some for the first times. It helped make futher neighbourhood gatherings a success, because some of them started coming to meetings to help organize.

activity: Stage Two of the Mansion Greens Community Garden "Forest Garden Project"
quote: During the event, and continuing since then, there have been many residents who have stopped by to ask what we are doing. We always take the time to explain the project and let them know how they can be involved. There is a sign at the Forest Garden with an email address.

Neighbours gathered in the circle to toast marshmallows and watch fireworks display in a nearby park.

We cleaned up the garbage at a public park.
I expect it will as we get to know each other by name.  The families with kids will meet each other and their kids will grow up together, learning to ride bikes on the street.

We stayed because there was so many fun things to do. Children were playing together who usually fight. Parents were standing and talking in groups not yelling whose child has done what this time. We can teach our children to respect the place where they live. We have to give these buildings a chance.

We are already talking about next years Family Fun Day, and the growing connections that we have from the FHCC Food Guild. This was a great out reach that people who did not even know that there was a community centre here! Many who were new to the area shared their amazement that this was a totally free event, and the scope of the food and activities for the kids, totally free was such a great thing for the community.
We are very pleased with this year turn out (over 100- highest ever!).  Lots of children and grown up as well.
Every time we get together we build greater friendships with those around us. There are always some neighbours who chose not to participate - but I even spotted of few of them at the Beat Party!

We had a chance to celebrate the accomplishment of partnering with the City for a chance to install the Little Library on City property. We always look for chances to celebrate the great space that we share.
Taken many many plants to New Hamburg Mennonite Second Hand Store to support charities, some went to support the neighbourhood gardennig club, and some went into our new garden!
It was a huge size of the area that was cleaned and the amount of refuse that was collected. People are coming together in greater numbers.
The energy and enthusiasm of the participants was amazing thanks to our youth!
I like that it's simple and inclusive. Because the games are so simple, we have all generations and cultures either participate or have fun watching.
Our event was free and open for all residents. We showed a family friendly movie.

It was a wonderful day where different members of the community came together to help clean up our Wetlands! The laurentian wetlands is a beautiful community space that is enjoyed by many different members of our community - not just the school! By cleaning it up we ensure that the space will be enjoyed by many during the year and will be a healthy space for wildlife.
This event recognizes the heritage of the neighbourhood by inviting people into homes
This event makes people proud to live in our area and is something the whole neighbourhood looks forward to every year
Any neighbourhood that cares not only about its own boundaries is a very special place to live and I think our residents recognize that.

quote: This event has sparked new friendships throughout the community and gave us the opportunity to meet people we have seen before but have yet to meet. We are actually Building Community!

quote: Neighbourhood come together to keep the community clean and well kept.. Our community have lots of kids and their safety and well being is our number one priority.

Traditional Kingsdale Neighbourhood Association party with crafts and games and food and meeting Santa. Children receiving gifts with photo booth for family pictures!
Gave a safe place for parents and their children to come and view a free movie!

Getting so many neighbours and people, including kids and elderly neighbours, out into the beauty of a December night. Someone read a poem, many people made their own lanterns. We had the major accomplishment of working with KW hydro to shut down the streetlights in our neighbourhood, so that people could really celebrate the darkness, and the light we all brought to that darkness.

activity: Guided walking tour in Kitchener Mount Hope Cemetery
quote: What also excites me is people discovering the rich stories in Mount Hope Cemetery.  This year we talked about people who have a link to the LRT, as well some famous people (Father David Bauer), some less famous people (T.H. Reider who made Kitchener the Rubber Capital of Canada) and the fugitive slave family that used to live in Queen's Bush.  One long time resident of Mount Hope Neighbourhood said that after coming on the tour he realized he had always seen the cemetery in black and white and now he saw it in "technicolor".

Victoria Hills is a very diverse community. Our neighbours come from all income, social, cultural and religious backgrounds. Victoria Hills is considered a settlement community. Our neighbours come from all parts of the world...Pakistan, India, Somali, Iraq, Bangladesh, etc
We brought neighbours together to dine together, socialize, get to know one another. This was a community building event.
It helps people recognize their neighbours.
People met new neighbours. Created a sense of community.
I think it has helped people get to know one another better, and encouraged stronger relationships. Our goal is to make our neighbourhood a stronger, closer, and more inclusive community.

Having gotten to know each other more in the past two years, it was a natural step in our grieving to meet together in the green space to remember our neighbour and friend.  Several additional neighbours came to this event - from further up Carlyle Place and backing into Carlyle Place.

This event helped families provide clothing for their families. Whether or not they had clothes to swap they could take what they needed for their children. This event is held spring and fall for the upcoming season. Kids grow so it provides parents the  opportunity to be prepared for now and in the near future.

The Pork supper brings together the whole BUC community. They work together and bring their gifts no matter how young or old. Members donate, phone members and friends of BUC, prepare food, serve, cleanup and have great fellowship together throughout the planning, preparing and serving this event

Previous to this year the activity was geared just towards members of the congregation. This year we opened it up to the community as part of our community outreach. We had several members attend that had not been to our church before. They were very excited to participate.

The most exciting part of the activity was being able to see the community members come together collectively to help make our area a clean place to live. Those who participated are proud to live in our ward, and their efforts during the clean reflected this.
When you are in your local community, you see a lot of familiar faces and new friendships develop after events like this.

It was great to see neighbours welcome everyone into their homes and pull together for this unique event. It was also wonderful to see our neighbours in the thick of winter, when we often do not get to see one another.

Yes it gets people in our community talking to each other. Building trust and appreciation. We've heard some great feedback on the garage sales that people look forward now to participating an that they often find great deals. With people building a connection with each other it makes it safer for the children.
